intro: Tarenna palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan tarenna, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers. Its fruits are typically small berries that turn red when mature. Tarenna palawanensis is often found in lowland to montane forests, growing in shaded, humid environments.
